snippet: Facing budget cuts and skepticism, the military is showing off its bomber fleet to warn adversaries and to make a case for upgrading the aging planes.
abstract: United States Air Force, facing budget cuts and skepticism, is showing off its long-range strategic bomber fleet to warn adversaries and to make a case for upgrading the aging planes; Air Force officials frequently argue to Congress that bombers could save the United States from deploying thousands of troops or aircraft carriers to strike targets as far away as China and North Korea.
lead_paragraph: Facing budget cuts and skepticism, the military is showing off its bomber fleet to warn adversaries and to make a case for upgrading the aging planes.

headline.main: At 27,000 Feet, an Air Force Plea to Preserve Its Bombers
headline.print_headline: At 27,000 Feet, an Air Force Plea to Preserve Its Bombers

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
